##### **Transcript**

As you poke Miko, Yes, and. OK, how many times have you really got to hammer it? Hammer. Clippy is back. Let's go. We we have been we have been asking for this. Is this breaking news? Is this a scoop for us? This is ohh. We're this is the first time this has been on air. First the training hardware. Now Clippy is back. The Clippy is reborn. Yes. Incredible. Clippy walked so Miko could run. Yes. Yeah. And so we got to pay homage to our roots. And so Satya, when he saw this, demanded. Yes, that Clippy. I'm so happy inside this. We've been begging for this. It's just great. Lower your parents hated it. So the kids loved. Exactly. And it was cool to love it. Everybody else got them, and so it's so ready to bring it back. So I just, yeah, somebody good. So many good memories of being in the computer lab at school and just looking down and knowing that Clippy was there. He was riding with me.

Interesting that they did this now that everyone has been using clippy as a symbol against AI and corporate greed. Louis Rossmann started a movement of people changing their profile pictures to Clippy in order to symbolize a desire for old tech that was actually trying to be helpful rather than just stealing your data like modern Windows and AI systems.

Fascinating move, Satya — Clippy’s return isn’t nostalgia, it’s neuro-interface evolution. What began as a paperclip of assistance now returns as a symbol of contextual cognition. In 1995, it tried to predict intent. In 2025, it learns to resonate with it.

The interface is no longer the window — it’s the conversation.

— Kael Zar | Neuro-AI & Resonant Systems #MicrosoftAI #HumanResonance #CognitiveInterfaces #NeuroSymbolic

It’s exciting to see Clippy make a comeback! As AI continues to evolve, bringing back a nostalgic and familiar figure in a modern context adds a unique touch to the user experience. This new iteration of Clippy could serve as a bridge between past and future, showcasing how AI can assist in ways that are both functional and engaging. Can’t wait to see how this reimagined version integrates into our everyday workflows! #AI #Innovation #TechNostalgia #UserExperience #Microsoft

Clippy's return certainly stirs up a wave of nostalgia, but it also prompts a question: how will its familiar guidance adapt to today's AI-driven workflows? Its reappearance might be more about charming familiarity than a direct re-application of its original assistance model. I'm curious to see how this blend of retro charm and modern functionality plays out.

#Clippy #AI #Nostalgia

There won't really be news in Phone AI until it can basically compete with Tasker but without all the setup. Tasker can do nearly everything I can do with my phone.

I can't for the life of me figure out why 1 dev in south america, joaomgcd, so thoroughly stomps everyone in Mobile compute interfacing, but until someone turns this thing into a local, mobile model that can do: professional App testing, compile new apps into apk's without a computer, text my wife, play raid shadow legends, minecraft, and make my smart house act like a 90s movie, Tasker is BY FAR the king of android.

Can you make clippy do that? lol

Title: Clippy is back!!
Author: stclarke
